hero.title: Our Courses
hero.subtitle: Master Modern Manufacturing Technologies
hero.description: From basic skills to professional mastery - our courses will help you master advanced manufacturing technologies

q1.question: What's the best way to start learning 3D printing?
q1.answer: Start with our Hobbyist Essentials course to learn the fundamentals, then practice with simple projects before advancing to more complex designs.

q2.question: How long does it take to master SLA printing?
q2.answer: Most students achieve proficiency within 4-6 weeks of regular practice, though mastery of advanced techniques may take 3-6 months of dedicated work.

q3.question: Which CAD software should I learn first?
q3.answer: For beginners, we recommend starting with Tinkercad or Fusion 360, as they offer intuitive interfaces while providing powerful design capabilities.

q4.question: What career opportunities are available after certification?
q4.answer: Graduates find roles in product design, manufacturing, healthcare, architecture, education, and entrepreneurship with their digital fabrication skills.

q5.question: How to troubleshoot common 3D printing issues?
q5.answer: Most problems relate to bed leveling, temperature settings, or filament quality. Our courses cover systematic approaches to identify and fix issues.

q6.question: What materials work best for different applications?
q6.answer: PLA is ideal for beginners, PETG for durability, ABS for mechanical parts, TPU for flexibility, and specialty filaments for specific requirements.

descriptions.hobbyistEssentials: Perfect for beginners who want to understand 3D printing fundamentals and start creating their own projects. Learn safety, maintenance, and basic troubleshooting.
descriptions.comprehensivePro: Advanced course covering professional techniques, optimization strategies, and industry applications. Includes advanced materials and troubleshooting.
descriptions.slaCompleteMastery: Comprehensive SLA training covering resin types, post-processing techniques, and high-detail printing. Perfect for jewelry, dental, and prototyping applications.
descriptions.cadcamProfessionalMastery: Master the complete digital manufacturing workflow from design to production. Learn industry-standard CAD/CAM software and precision manufacturing techniques.
descriptions.digitalFabricationWorkshop: Intensive workshop covering multiple digital fabrication techniques including 3D printing, laser cutting, and CNC machining. Perfect for rapid prototyping skills.
descriptions.scanningWorkshop: Learn 3D scanning techniques for reverse engineering and quality control. Master both hardware and software aspects of 3D scanning technology.

skills.skill1: UV printer setup, operation, and material compatibility
